t: From Defeated Ruler to Conquering King
Now,*pn daughter who is under attack, you*ln slash yourself in grief; a*ln siege is set against us! They*ln are striking the judge of Israel on*ln the cheek with a rod.
Bethlehem*ln Ephrathah, you*ln are small among the clans of Judah; one*ln will come from you to*ln be ruler over Israel for me. His*ln origin is from antiquity, from*ln ancient times.
Therefore,*ln Israel will be abandoned until the time when*ln she who is in labor has given birth; then*ln the rest of the ruler’s brothers will return to*ln the people of Israel.

He*ln will stand and shepherd them in*ln the strength of the Lord,*s in*ln the majestic name of the Lord*s his God. They*ln will live securely, for*ln then his greatness will extend to*ln the ends of the earth.
He*ln will be their peace. When*ln Assyria invades our land, when*ln it marches against our fortresses, we*ln will raise against it seven shepherds, even*ln eight leaders of men.

They*ln will shepherd the land of Assyria with the sword, the*ln land of Nimrod with a drawn blade. So*ln he will rescue us from Assyria when*ln it invades our land, when*ln it marches against our territory.
Then*pn the remnant of Jacob will*ln be among many peoples like*ln dew from the Lord,*s like*ln showers on the grass, which*ln do not wait for anyone or*ln linger for mankind.

Then*ln the remnant of Jacob will*ln be among the nations, among many peoples, like*ln a lion among animals of the forest, like*ln a young lion among flocks of sheep, which*ln tramples and tears as it passes through, and*ln there is no one to rescue them.
Your*ln hand will be lifted up against your adversaries, and*ln all your enemies will be destroyed.
In*pn that day — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — I*pn will remove your horses from you and*ln wreck your chariots.
I*ln will remove the cities of your land and*ln tear down all your fortresses.
I*ln will remove sorceries from your hands, and*ln you will not have any more fortune-tellers.
I*ln will remove your carved images and*ln sacred pillars from you so*ln that you will no longer worship the*ln work of your hands.
I*ln will pull up the Asherah poles from among you and*ln demolish your cities.
I*ln will take vengeance in anger and wrath against*ln the nations that have not obeyed me.
